page.title: 10AMENITIES
page.content: The amenities in the block are sparse.At Buck's Mills village there is a free carpark,a telephone kiosk and a post box,but,although the beach is popular there are no public toilets.There is a small shop catering mostly for tourists,but it has some goods for local consumption.This shop was a small holding and a Temperance hotel.A travelling library visits once a fortnight.A Parochial Church Room built in 1928 serves as a village hall.At West Bucks there is a local builder who is also an undertaker.There too is a family firm of agricultural and building contractors.The A39 lay-by at London Lodge has a post box cleared twice daily.
